Also nevermind the fact that Cole the server NEVER came back to ask (1) how our food was or (2) if we needed anything. We waited because our drinks sat empty for 20 minutes. 20!!! That pissed off my husband. He didn't mind the 20% discount to the other table and the constant talking to them, but he did mind that we were IGNORED so that Cole could talk to his new friends.  As such, we left a 10% tip (which my dear husband NEVER does) and will not be returning to this location. I don't care how good the food is, nothing makes up for poor service.
I LOVE CPK. My mouth drools every time I step into the restaurant. 5 stars, all day everyday.

Sat out on the patio near a heat lamp but was advised that all of the heat lamps are broken. Food was mediocre. Service was poor. May be the last time I dine here. My favs (used to be) their bbq chicken pizza and bbq chicken chopped salad.

Of the two we visit, this one's our fav.  The service is fairly good, the Chopped Salad, at half-size, combined with an appetizer or flatbread pizza feeds us both nicely for a tidy sum. If you're being dietarily restricted, it's a tasty way to go, and, as they're a chain, you can know the caloric content with no surprises.
good pizzas, always order the spinach dip to start with.. avoid the pastasssss

My boss and a couple of my co-workers came here to treat me out for my last day of work. The environment was very casual and pretty elegant, considering the fact I thought it wasn't a sit-n.  The waitress was friendly, but it was down time (so not a lot of customers). I ordered the 4 cheese ravioli, I thought the sauce was pretty tasty until my coworker said it's sweet like ketchup. It made me think twice but overall, even though the portion seemed small, it really filled me up
OMG! The pear-Gorgonzola pizza is killer! I could eat it for a week straight.

The CPK here now has wi-fi, (been so for 2 months) so that's a plus from the other CPKs. Their orders are just as good as any CPK that I've been in, and at lunch and after lunch time, there isn't much people, so it's an ideal place to choose if you want some peace of mind with you or a small group of friends. Mmmm... mac and cheese here is delicious.

I've tried the California Club Pizza (bacon, grilled chicken, mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, lettuce tossed in mayonnaise and avocado) and its my favorite here. Anything with mayo deserves 5 stars, but the food is kind of pricey and finding parking is such a drag so overall 3 stars.  I also really like the Chinese Chicken Salad, the sweet and sour sesame dressing is on point.
By far the best pizza I have tried (in the USA). Try the extra thin whole grain crust. Wild mushroom one is to die for. Tiramisu is awesome too.

Typical chain restaurant, decent service, decent food. Usually the shortest wait out of the 4 big restaurants along the side of Oakridge. Our faves: Chicken Tequila Fettuccine, Avocado Club Egg Rolls, Thai Crunch Salad. Definetely reccommend the call ahead wait list, 1 hour max before your arrival.
I have gone here many times. The thin crust pizza is tasty, and most of the other entrees are good. The service is usually great, although on occasion there have been issues.
Delicious salads, but ridiculously over-priced. Also, a very long wait time.  Almost worth the wait.

I recently went here for lunch with a friend and I always order the California Cobb salad which was good but I've noticed their "half order" has gotten much smaller and a "full order" was the size of what their half used to be only 6mo. ago.. The reason I note this is that the prices have not decreased but the amount of food for the price has. Might start looking for a new favorite Cobb salad
Always Good Service !! My Favs:  Grilled Chicken Caesar Focaccia Sandwich. Pesto Chicken Pizza Hawaiian BBQ Chicken Pizza =)

I don't know what to tell you.  I came here for our friends birthday dinner I just simply asked the waitress for their best seafood dish.   She brought the most delicious seafood pasta I've ever had. Yummmm.   I'm going back!!

I had just came home from work. My girlfriend didn't cook so we asked our daughter where she wanted to have dinner.  She said "C-P-K!" I'd rather just have a bowl of Pho... fulfilling and inexpensive. We couldn't say no, it was her birthday. My sister and her boyfriend joined.  Our orders were taken: Chipotle Chicken Pizza, Sicilian Pizza, Chicken Tequila Fettucini, BBQ Chicken Pizza.  My Pizza was a disappointment, the Chipotle Chicken Pizza didn't compare to the Wild Mushroom or the Vegetarian w/ Japanese Eggplant. The pizza had a cold pile of corn and black bean salsa in the middle, which didn't compliment the warm pizza at all. But I didn't complain, I'm fairly easy going.  My sister's Sicilian Pizza was also a disappointment. She does share how she feels with the waiter. She said that the Sicilian Pizza was different from the last time she tried it--this one was no crispy and seemed stale. The Asian lady manager came and apologized and asked if she wanted something else and ordered her the Vegetarian w/ Japanese Eggplant and another Sicilian Pizza... both on the house!  They definitely have changed their ways and are trying hard to keep their customers happy. After our meals, we were ready to leave, but not before leaving a $20 tip. Yeah, it covered for the costs of "on-the-house" pizza, but I just loved their customer service. In the end, it's the thought that counts!
Awesome customer service from Kaila. Will definitely be back here again! The two dishes were prepared to perfection! Awesome place & warm environment.

Dude, what a brilliant strategy to build a CPK right next to Cheesecake Factory because the overflow must be awesome business! I never understood why the lines for Cheesecake Factory are so long when the food doesn't blow your mind, but I digress.  California Pizza Kitchen is a perfectly good substitute, and the menu is complete with choices without being a tome of headache and dizzying panoply of foods. Our waiter was just fine, but the kids' menu is still suffering from a lack of creativity -- where are the veggies?
Their Harbanera Salsa was awesome. I would just come to this place for salsa.

Went there on a Sunday around 1:00pm Party of 3. Seated right away. Somehow they screwed up our order. (Though they didn't tell us how.) It took a while to get 2 personal pizza's and a salad. But they gave us 20% off.  Without even complaining. Service was good.  Food was good.

Service is good; but WHERE'S THE MEAT???? I don't understand how when you order a pizza with chicken or any sort of meat and it somes out with none or hardly any. Very, very skimpy on the meat. I have tried to order something else since the pizza does not do it for me and ordered the whole wheat pasta; every time I have done that they mess up the order and send me the regular pasta. I have usually eaten the order as is but have returned it once to give their whole wheat pasta a try. I have to say the whole wheat pasta is very good!!! I would go again not for the pizza but for the pasta its above average... Oh yes, and the crab cakes.... that alone gets another star!

I've always been a big fan of CPK.  Their food tastes great, is reasonably priced, and I've never experienced bad service.  This time, however, I got sick from their pizza. I went to the CPK at the Oakridge Mall a couple of weeks ago for lunch, and overall I had a great experience.  However, several hours after eating there I started to feel sick, and ended up with food poisoning for the rest of the day.  I ordered the Hawaiian BBQ Chicken pizza.  I'm sure that I got sick from eating this because I hadn't eaten out for several days prior, and shared the exact same meals with other people who didn't get sick.  At CPK, I was the only one who ordered this pizza, and I was the only one who got sick. I definitely won't be eating here again.

I have eaten most of the pizzas and they are delicious to the fullest taste that you can be able to swallow and have your taste buds experienced. The restaurant itself is very passionate with all of the art designed on the boxes that they have for to-go meals. the service is very friendly and has the least amount of errors when it comes to getting the drinks served and getting the food prepared at a steady pace. The temptation to getting an extra order of pizza is always happening when i come and eat due to the pizza being so delicious i always contemplate to take some extra to-go.

My first visit to a CPK, can you believe? I haven't avoided this place at all -- in fact, pizza is one of my favorite things to eat (shut up, I know I sound like a kid) -- I've just never been with people who have said, "hey, let's go eat CPK!" To start off, the wait estimate given to us was about 45 minutes, on a Monday evening, the day after Christmas. This didn't bother me truthfully, considering the restaurant appeared to be quite small, and the rest of our party (we were 6) were not there yet. I didn't keep track of the actual wait but it felt a lot less than 45 minutes. Our server, Cole, greeted us and took our drink order. He appeared to be very polite and well versed in his job. I ordered their original BBQ Chicken Pizza and I have to say it was INCREDIBLE! For a chain restaurant making pizza, they've locked down this so-called signature pizza of theirs. You bet I finished every slice! I felt pretty full afterward and didn't order dessert. Neither did anyone else. Now, here's where I begin the negative aspects. Throughout dinner, Cole wasn't around much. I noticed he was also bartending for the evening, which I can understand is a consuming aspect, but if you know you're going to be swamped, ask for help. My friends and I were in need of refills for our drinks, and Cole finally got them towards the end of the meal. This is a huge pet peeve of mine, but considering how much fun I was having with my friends, I didn't let it get to me. In fact, I originally planned to omit this part of the review. However, things only fell flat after this. Cole brought out our check WITHOUT REMOVING A SINGLE PLATE FROM THE TABLE. I tried to give him an appalling look, but I don't think he got it. We had dishes everywhere and I KNOW Cole saw we had a Christmas gift exchange planned for after dinner because he sure seemed attentive to the lady with the baby at the table right next to us (we all assumed it was his wife/girlfriend/someone important), and our gifts were on the booth-side of the table, right ON the seat NEXT to her. Even if we didn't have a gift exchange planned  -- even if it was just me eating by myself -- YOU NEVER DROP A CHECK WITHOUT BUSSING YOUR TABLE FIRST. If serving had a holy book of sorts, that would be a commandment.  So now, here we are in a cluttered mess trying to sort out how we're going to pay (some of us have card, some of us have cash) and after a good 10 minutes, Cole comes to check on us to see if we're ready. We tell him no and I think it finally sets into him that he hasn't done his job -- or completed it, rather -- as he starts lifting plates in the stacks that WE put in the center of the table for him. Yeah, THAT caught his attention. Anyway, our gift exchange process was a quick one as we had after-dinner plans (we're not cupcakers) and I believe we left him a less than deserving tip. I am NOT proud of this, trust me, he started off great and even kept his charm 'til the very end, but you just don't treat a party like that. It's disrespectful -- it says to me, "I don't give a damn about you so I'm going to let you sit in your filth until it bothers you enough to leave," more or less. 3 1/2 stars.

First of all I am a die heart CPK fan but this location needs to be taught in customer service. Their hosts were rude short and need to learn that sarcasm isn't always as flattering as they think it is. Me and my fiancé came to eat mind you I'm 8 1/2 months pregnant and seemed like the city of San Jose had to shut the strip mall at 830p we get there and the manager on duty Erik seemed to be very inventive and sits us immediately but then the hosted make a comment saying "oh I wish I had slammed the doors on your face." I personally thought it was rude and very unnecessary to be said. Overall I believe if they teach their hostes customer services they would be alright.

today, wifey wanted something refreshing.  so i said hey, why not cpk?  we had one of our first dates at cpk...haha...so yeah...the food here has a special place in my heart.  -=D ok...the restaurant was probably 35 degrees...well, i'm exaggerating...but really, i freakin love cold weather...but this place was an icebox!  i was shivering with a slice of pizza in my hand! kudos to having the sharks game on...good stuff.  our server was nice...she was attentive and quick although she was super overwhelmed by so many tables.  we ordered the usual...the cpk cobb salad and a pizza...this time we had the all meat pizza.  everything was yummy...including the dessert!  we shared the apple cobbler with ice cream...MmMmM...the crust was just super sweet and buttery...how could you possibly go wrong with that combination?  haha.   i have to be in the mood to come here...but when i do, i usually have a pretty reasonable experience.  go cpk!

You've probably been here, and there's not much to say about the place. They have pizzas, some of which are fairly unique. I've been here a few times, and I always like ot try the odd combinations. My favorite thus far has been the Thai Chicken pizza, which has peanut sauce on it. Sounds weird, but is absolutely delicious.

I went there on a lunch date and we were not impressed with our meal. My daughters noodles with alfredo  sauce was not tossed in the sauce and it was hard to tell at first if there was even any sauce at all.  My friend and I shared a california club, and a margarita pizza, neither were good. The club was the worst.  I have been a customer for years and this was my first experience with the one on Blossom Hill. I don't hold it against the restaurant that the food was mediocre. It is a flaw with the Menu. I would go back and order my usual the Pear and Gorgonzola pizza.

Appetizers: Try the Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings! Very yummy. I would pass on the crab cakes. Pizza: My absolute favorite. The Original BBQ Chicken, with no onions and no cilantro for me. I love BBQ sauce and I love chicken, so put the two together and it's the perfect pizza in my book. An old friend introduced this to me knowing how much I would love this combination, and that person was right on point=]. Pasta: Chicken Tequila Fettuccine is our usual item of choice and someone in our group will always order it. Remember to squeeze the lime over the entire pasta and mix it up for extra delicious flavor! This place has the best raspberry iced tea, hands down! It's just the perfect amount of sweetness and it's never watered down like most places that brew it. Trust me, I always get refills.

I haven't been to CPK in years! I was invited by a colleague for lunch and was impressed with the quality of service and ambiance. Parking was a bit of the challenge, as it is most of the time if you're going to Oakridge mall. I drove around for about 10 minutes during lunchtime before I eventually found a spot. When I arrived, the waitress brought out mini slices of bread and oil for dipping. The bread was fresh and warm, I practically devoured the whole plate as I waited for my collegue to arrive. We started off with the ceasar salad, which was standard but good. I decided to order a pizza, given that it's their specialty. I opted for one of their original hand tossed pizza - the Wild Mushroom because I love mushrooms and it was highly recommended on Yelp. It comes with four types shaved cremeni, shiitake, white, Portobello mushrooms with mozzarella and pecorino romano cheeses. I love meat on my pizza, so I was happy to hear that I could add chicken to my pizza. The pizza was delish and the chicken was moist and soft, not overcooked or dry. The portion was big and I had a couple of slices to bring home for left overs. Overall I was happy with my choice and wouldn't mind coming back here again.

In the past, I would have given this restaurant 5 stars for their service alone.  They would have you seated right away, have bread and water on your table within 2 minutes, have your order within 5 minutes, and have your order on your table within another 5-7 minutes.  I held them as the standard for some restaurants that were near me with lousy service, that I gave up on.  Unfortunately, the service at CPK has slackened off dramatically.  I've now sat trying to get a waiter's attention, or my order, for extremely lengthy periods of time, while watching the manager standing, chatting away with 2 men at a table right next to me.  Now, I have to ask for items multiple times, and have had some frustrating experiences.  Once, in the past, my waiter asked if I'd like the rest of my salad boxed up, which I had about 1/4 remaining.  I told him yes, but when he wanted to box it himself, I pointed out what looked to be an eyelash, and said I didn't want that in my salad, since he wasn't letting me box it myself.  I wasn't actually complaining; however, next I knew, the waiter brought me out a boxed up full salad that was freshly made to take home.  That type of service for even minor issues, was impressive.  Now, CPK seems to be lacking in their past service, and don't seem to do much to make up for their much lower level of service or issues.  But, because of their much higher standards in the past, I'm averaging them out for now.   As for the food... it is good.  Some good salads, some unique pizzas, and I like their new cedar plank salmon.  Because parking at this mall is atrocious, I will most often call in an order and park in their 10 minute spaces, and pick up the meal.   I'm sad to see CPK's former superior service drop so much, as I think of great service as a very key component of the dining experience.  I'm keeping their rating at a 4 for now, in the hopes that it is just a blip, and will soon be back up to scratch.
Superb food but limited on the variety (hey, it's a pizza kitchen).  Service never deviates from outstanding.

I was just here with my brother Mike for lunch and it was good.  He had the BBQ chicken salad, my daughter had a kids pepperoni pizza and I had the waldorf salad.  The service and food are good but I think for the pricesthetician you pay there, the food could be better.

I have always enjoyed my meals at these restaurants, no matter which one I visited.  On this occasion, we went on a Wednesday and it was not very busy.  It was way too cold inside so we chose the patio which was very comfortable until the very end of our stay when it cooled down.. We were done eating, so it was fine. I had the mahi-mahi with stir fry veggies which was delicious.  In addition, it was under 600 calories!  The service was good, but probably not quite as attentive given the somewhat slow evening. We enjoyed our meal and the visiting.  Although the patio is along a busy thoroughfare, we did not find that bothersome.

My boyfriend has always been hesitant to eat at California Pizza Kitchen after a couple bad incidents at other locations. Unfortunately, he was forced to go on our date night after BJs, Buca Di Beppo, and Cheesecake Factory were packed. Yeah, the menu list is smaller than most dinner places, but their food's not as heavy as most chain places. We shared a Garlic Chicken Pizza and an order of their mini bite Korean tacos. I have always loved the honey wheat crust on their pizzas.  Long story short, our waiter was really nice and my boyfriend was happy. We'll definitely be coming back.

we love the one in palo alto and stanford and i always order the same thing. we just moved to los gatos and thought we'd give this one a try. mistake. cheese pizza- my 12 year old said it was dry and tasted like cardboard garlic fettucine with chicken-bland and dry hubby's fettucine -bayou? shrimp, etc..way too spicy my ginger dumplings..lacking flavor and spicy hot. $60 wasted on a blech dinner. we wont be back.

I can always depend on CPK for a good meal. Lately, my waiters haven't been giving me my free bread. I have to ask for it. Besides that service is pretty good. They have a bunch of pizzas to choose from, so there should be something for everybody! Tortilla Spring Rolls - You MUST try at least once. I pretty much come here for these and the pizza is an afterthought. It comes with 6 rolls, and you can choose 2 kinds. I stick to Baja Chicken and Thai Chicken. I think I slightly prefer the Baja Chicken, but the Thai Chicken comes with this AMAZING peanut sauce. I always ask for extra sauce, and I never let the server take it away from me. After I finish the rolls, I dip my free bread in the sauce.  Besides the rolls I usually get either the Thai Chicken or Jamaican Jerk pizza. Both are good, but the rolls are really my favorite part of eating at CPK.  Try to save room for dessert! The red velvet cake, tiramisu, and chocolate souffle cake are all good choices.
Love thin crust Jamaican jerk pizza.  Very flavorful and nice spice kick to it.  I recommend. Also the salted caramel pudding dessert is amazing.  Service was great too.

I have not yet dined in at this restaurant but I have gotten them delivered to my home.   California Pizza Kitchen contracts with   for their delivery services which allowed for easy online ordering.  I ordered the Thin Crust Sicilian Pizza which has now been entered my Favorite Pizzas list.  I loved it.  It was phenomenal.  Also ordered the Four Cheese Ravioli which was also good but not world changing.   Overall, food was great although the price were not cheap but were within what I was expecting.  No surprises at the bill.  I would order from here again but probably not on a regular basis.  I will hopefully be updating this entry once I have visited the restaurant itself.
WOWZA that chicken tequila fettuccine is delicious! Don't be afraid to order it because it's a pizza restaurant... I honestly thought it was better than the BBQ chicken pizza.
My first visit to a CPK was in Vegas. I was hooked because if the food. High quality, just the right amount and unique dishes. The staff is well trained, make ng you feel welcome and special.

Brought my family of 5 here for dinner to be competly disappointed. We have always LOVED the California Pizza Kitchen at Oakridge. We were on the west side of town and decided to give the Valley Fair location a try. This location does not serve some of the all time favorite items including the raviollis along with the tiramisu. After we ordered and waited 15 mins we asked for the bread we normally enjoy at the Oakridge location and we were told they had no bread. I was sitting with 3 starving teenagers for 35 mins. The waiter said he would bring his manger, which she told 20 mins to come to the table. when she arrived her attitude was OUT OF THIS WORLD, she was sarcastic and practically yelling. She stated that the bread is a free/complementary item so I basically should not be suprised by the fact that they are out. When I asked if there was anything (chips/crackers) they could bring for the kids to snack on until the food was ready, as we had been waiting quite some time and the kids were very hungry. She said I was welcome to order an appetizer, which would then need to be made in the kitchen. I went on Yelp to look if this location has these types of reviews. The manager looked over at my phone screen and then stated "Don't threaten to write a review on Yelp". This highly upset our grandmother who said that we did not say anything, but we do have the right to write a review on yelp. We asked that the manager not return to our table because her attitude and tone of voice was aggressive at the point. She returned to our table twice after that. Firstly time to show me the time that our order was entered in there system, then she came to deliver our food. I guess it was the mangers way of making herself feel in charge. We ate and quickly left. On our way out we noticed a few other tables were having issues. One demanding to speak to a different manager. My family will avoid CPK at Valley Fair at all costs.

I recently started to like CPK. The first time I went there, I wasn't all that thrilled with the food but the more I go, I took a liking to the place! My son and my daughter- 4 and 2 love it here because it's kid friendly, they give you bread and butter which is their fave and mine and my husband's while we wait for our delicious food. The kid's menu is great also.  We always order a full salad and one or 2 different pizzas and it's more than plenty of food. They also have beer on tap- what's better than pizza and beer?! I love their cobb salad- actually all of the salads are great and the pizzas are great too. Love that they give you unlimited amount of bread- which is freshly baked!
I got one of those fruity drinks that I couldn't even finish. The food wasn't good today. We came during dinner and it wasn't that busy.

Omg I love this place! I love the different pizzas and variety of toppings they have. Every time I come here it's always satisfying. Their lettuce wraps are the best!!! I will not go anywhere else for lettuce wraps. They're so fresh and the meat mixture isn't overly salty.
Very good food. This place has delicious pizzas and salads.  The only problem is that its a little on the expensive side. But I will go back again despite the price. Service was excellent.

We needed to carb up before the SJ Rock N' Roll Half Marathon, so my friend and I decided to go to CPK.  It must've been homecoming that night because there were a ton of dressed up high school kids that night.  When we walked in, there were people waiting already, but since we were a table of 2, we got seated right away. Even with a packed restaurant, service was still good.  We ordered shortly after we sat down.  E got the Pesto Chicken Pizza(   ) and I got the Sausage & Pepper Penne(   ).  The food came out pretty quickly.  My penne was yummy as usual, and I cleaned off my plate. If you're counting calories, they list everything out on the menu.  Not so good for me, since I ate my whole dish...about 1000 calories.  EEK!  At least I burned it off the next day!

I came here a couple of days ago for my boyfriend's sis's birthday dinner. I've never eaten at cpk before but the birthday girl seemed to really like this place so I looked forward to the dining experience.  Crowded crowded crowded!! The place was crawling with kids! Don't get me wrong, I like kids; but I honestly felt like i was at a chucky cheeses. The line was extremely long; but luckily, we called in an hour ahead of time to put our names on the wait list. Our table was all set when we arrived! :)) - Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese wasn't alllll that. One thing i hate about mac n' cheese is when it gets cold and the cheese hardens up. That pretty such sums up this dish; but in patty form...and deep fried.  - Korean BBQ Steak Tacos were pretty good. The spicy sauce they have on top really brought the whole dish together. On the other hand, just eating the meat alone, it had a consistency of really low grade meat...no bueno :( - Caramelized Peach  Salad was yummm(: i love fruit in my salad and the peaches and cranberries were definitely a hit for me. I think they put a little too much Gorgonzola cheese but other than that, i was still a happy camper! - Norwegian Atlantic Salmon wasn't as great as i expected it to be. The pasta was really bland and i had to add tons of salt & pepper, even lemon juice. My salmon was overcooked and it had a hard layer all around the fish... like they pan fried it for so long the sides turned hard.  Its a sad thing when the salads are better than the entrees. But then again...I didn't try the pizza either..my boyfriend says "you're so embarrassing. Going to a pizza place and eat everything but the pizza is like going to a steakhouse and not eat the steak".  hahaha ooopsies! ill be sure to get the pizza if i ever come back! Or...ill just come back for the Salad ;]

BBQ chicken pizza was dry and flavorless with only 1 small piece of chicken per slice? To their credit they took it off the bill after the fact but ruined our dining experience :(. Sonoma chicken coop way better BBQ chicken pizza! Skip this place!

Wife, baby and I got there on Friday around 6:30 pm. We asked how long for a table, 15 minutes. Other customers came after us and they were seated before us... Couple with kid(s), 3 teens were seated before us and we had been waiting for 10 minutes before the teens.   I asked the girl who was running the waiting list why everyone got a table before us? She said" You are next..."  We walked out of the restaurant.  What do you expect when you have teenage girls running the front?    The funny part is that they were wearing a T-shirt " We have a new Attitude..." poor service and a bad attitude!

It's an absolutely gorgeous, almost Spring-like day here in San Jose, and California Pizza Kitchen gave me a cold!  More than one of us at the table were freezing, and asked three people to turn the temperature up.  Apparently, someone else in the restaurant was hot and requested the A/C to be turned on full blast.  I ended up going back to my car to get my down jacket.  And for some reason, our server was overwhelmed and couldn't get stuff out to us in a timely manner.  She seemed to have the busiest groups of tables of all the servers in the restaurant.  My drink was refilled once after many requests, and then never again despite further requests.  I'm not complaining about the server, but maybe management should review how they are arranging their customers. On a positive note, I love the smashed pea and barley soup, and some of the pizzas are okay.  I almost prefer the frozen versions, as I get to enjoy those in the comfort of my own home (and not freeze to death).  CPK is famous among moms and expectant moms, and moms who are both.  So, if you are averse to screaming children and big bellies, avoid weekday lunches here.

First off, the customer service here is HORRIBLE. There were barely any people in the restaurant and the weather was nice outside, so we asked the lady at the front desk if we could sit outside. For a party of 6 people, that shouldn't be a problem! She reluctantly told us that "the tables outside were closed," but we just smiled and told her we wanted to sit outside anyways, and she couldn't do anything but agree with us. Our waiter was this Mexican, kinda big guy with glasses and a slightly feminine voice. I forgot his name, but he was SO unfriendly and sarcastic and it wasn't funny at all. My friends and I are always joking around so yes, "we can take a joke" but this guy was just so grumpy and bitchy. We all just ignored his attitude and just continued on chit chatting while waiting for our food. When the waiter came back to give us our drinks, he cracked another stupid joke that came out to be kind of rude and offensive to all of us, so we didn't say anything in return. Our food came and he seemed impatient when serving our Parmesan cheese. This totally ruined my mood and appetite so I ended up not finishing my dish. To top that off, he barely came back to check up on our table. Every time he did, he gave us a huge attitude. When it was time to pay, I asked him if it was okay to split the bill into three parts. He rudely asked, "HOW?" And I rudely answered, "UH, by couples." He rolled his eyes and walked away. He packed our to-go plates for us and didn't even say thank you or come again or whatever. My friends and I wanted a group picture, so one of my girlfriends went back into the restaurant to ask the same waiter to take a picture for us. She was in there for a while. When she finally came out, ANOTHER waitress was offering to take a picture for us when my friend specifically asked HIM to come out... Wtf? This was the first time EVER that I felt like not tipping (even though I was nice enough to tip anyway) simply because the service here was SO bad. I recommend going to the CPK at Valley Fair because their service and staff are so much friendlier and funnier! 1 star for the food and another star for the nice waitress who took pictures for us. I don't think I'm ever coming here again though.

I've been here multiple times and never had a problem but I recently visited again for lunch and was very disappointed. Nothing against the food itself but maybe the communication between kitchen and other staff. Our waiter was distracted and inconsistent. We had to try and flag him down since he wasn't very good with checking in with us and had to wait forever even to get a water refill. When my mom was ordering her food she asked for a salad with grilled shrimp. He even said "okay a salad with chicken" no sir... I said shrimp. And he repeated it back the second time, "Okay great, a salad with shrimp." So you would expect it to be right once it came to the table. Nope, instead it still had chicken. So we had him take it back and get shrimp which took a while because it had to be grilled. Second time around and now there was no dressing on the lettuce. Instead of apologizing and saying he would fix it, he just laughed and said huh, weird... And then walked away. Hopefully next time all that is avoided, because we do love the food!

Have been going here for years, but not any more. Went for dinner last night with my parents and during the whole dinner we had 2 flies buzzing the table the whole time.. Inside!  Told the manager and she just laughed it off and that it happens and they get someone here monthly to control the bugs.  she obviously wanted out of our conservation and quickly left to go hang out in the kitchen. Lost out business for good.

Three words: Jamaican Jerk Pizza. I don't even eff around with the other stuff anymore.  I've found my pie and I'm hooked.  Super sweet and spicy - chicken, bacon, onions...Mmmm.  I also go with the honey wheat crust and a side of ranch dressing. I've also had their pastas, salads, desserts and other pizzas - all good!  Please do me one favor - don't go in there and try to get a traditional Italian pizza (pepperoni or combo)... if you do, you missed the point and will be severely disappointed.

Came in to Cpk Friday night after about 6 months of not dinning here. My family and I were avid fans of this location for many years but after our last experience I will not be going back. First and for most the whole staff has done a complete 360. The food had always been mediocre but the staff had always been the reason why we returned time and time again. We came mostly for Joyce and Ginger. Both amazing bartenders with the sweetest dispositions. I can't even begin to explain the service we encountered this last weekend. I will not mention a name because I'm not in the business of getting anyone in trouble, but for one we sat for nearly 10 minutes without even so much as a acknowledgment. Once we were greeted our drinks took another 10 minutes. Not to mention our waiter knew nothing about the menu and it showed. Our appetizers came out the same time as our food and all he could say was it happens like that quite often. WTH. On top of that my family and I listened to a whole conversation  our server was having with another co worker that was not only inappropriate but rather offensive. We then proceeded to ask about our two favorite girls and our waiter told us that one had moved to LA and the other was fired and proceeded to tell us the story as if it was breaking news. I'm sorry but a simple they don't work here anymore would have sufficed yet they continued on with this defamation of character that made me feel almost uncomfortable. Little did they know my family and I still are loyal regulars of hers. Between the tardiness of our food and the lack professionalism we asked to speak to a manager. But it seemed as if we were being rushed out of the door by our server and we're told the manager was very busy and then another server came over to ask if there was anything they could do for us. We're we supposed to believe that this young child like girl was the manager. We payed our bill and left never to return. If your really craving CPK I recommend the Valley Fair store. My 2 stars are only for the few crew members that still remain that remind us of why we came back  in the first place.

So, funny story.  Let's rewind back five years to my senior year in high school.  I was going out to dinner with a boy I liked, and I was nervous about it, because I didn't know if it was a "date" or not.  My friends all told me that if he paid, it was a date.... Long story short, on our trip here (five years ago), our pizzas ended up taking awhile to come out... Annnnnd, the manager comped our meal.  Great, except it really didn't answer my "date" question.  The boy DID pay the tip though!! So why am I telling you this?  Well, fast forward five years.  I visited CPK yesterday with my boyfriend (no, not the same boy... I don't think he though it was a date after all, haha...), and he ordered a barbecue chicken pizza with no onions.  When our pizzas came out, his had onions on it.  After this was fixed, and the manager and two other servers apologized, we ate, and the waitress brought out the bill and told us they took the pizza off the bill because of the mix-up. So my point?  This California pizza kitchen is pretty good about compensating for mistakes!! So, the pizzas here are pretty good, though I've come to realize that with the sweetness of their crust and their sauce, meat doesn't really WORK with their pizzas.  It's just an odd combination.. I recommend NOT getting a traditional type of pizza here (like pepperoni, sausage, and mushroom).  My favorite pizza is the five cheese and tomato. Also, service can be pretty off here.  If they screw up your pizzas, they DO compensate, BUT... If not, don't expect good service.  After they brought our pizzas out the other day, then took my boyfriend's back, I wanted parmesean cheese.  I looked and looked for our waitress, and then ANYONE to bring it, but no one came close... So, my boyfriend ended up walking up to the kitchen area and asking.   CPK is okay, and I definitely eat here every once in awhile, but it's definitely not my favorite pizza place.
Had a great time here! the service was prompt and the food was fresh. lots of kids but hey, what can you do?

Met the friendliest host, Anthony Gardner. He'll make you feel at home. Great food. A little pricey but you get for what you pay for. This place would be my 2nd choice after BJ's to eat around the mall.

The food & service was OK. It was really nice for the manager to walk around the restaurant to check on the tables but other than that you are better off to eat at the CPK in Valleyfair. I ate dinner with a couple of friends & my husband & at first our waitress was on point. She got our orders & drinks correct but soon after we received our food we were ignored. From that point, that is when her service went down hill. She forgot to clear our plates after we ate bread & forgot to refill our drinks. Anyhow, after dinner we all ordered some dessert. However, as she was going around the table asking only 7 people what they wanted to eat, she forgot to ask me!!! Though there were 5 guys eating with us, I'm not sure why I was forgotten. Furthermore, you would think she would have cleared the table before our dessert arrived, but again, she didn't. So as we're eating our dessert our table was a complete mess with numerous plates, empty glasses and napkins stacking up! Furthermore, as my husband wanted our pizza boxed to go, we didn't get our pizza box back till about ten minutes later, she even did the same to the table next to us! Sad to say she cut her tip in half, however she only has herself to blame!

FOOD: -Type: Gourmet Pizza -Variety: plenty -Quality: between good and excellent, although it could be "shinier and robust" -Quantity: enough to keep you full, probably will not end up taking home. -Price: could be cheaper SERVICE: -Employees: friendly and quick. we gave the waitresses a lot of trouble and they were very accommodating. -Timeliness: fast enough. ENVIRONMENT: -Location: easy to spot -Ambience: bright -Decor: customized with decorated pizza boxes, nice touch -Cleanliness: clean. OVERALL: good but not excellent. the pizza wasn't terribly exciting but a one-time interesting thing. -Would attend again? if my coworkers wanted to go again

I dont think I will ever go back to this location again!  I got food poisoning from this place.  I actually found out that their cleanliness isnt quite good and many people who did go the day that I went got sick as well.  The food wasn't as I expected.  The pizza was overcooked and their bread that they serve beforehand was stale!!  There are so many pizza places that are better than this place.  BEWARE!!!

I've dined at this location of CPK about six or seven times.  Even though it's not my favorite restaurant among the offerings at Oakridge (come to think of it, I think all of the restaurants there are better than CPK), I've probably eaten here the most, after Bucca di Beppo.  It's never been spectacular, but I've never been disappointed or had a bad experience here. I used to stick to the Wild Mushroom (with chicken) each time, until I started alternating between that and their Peking Duck pizza.  Then, after that was pulled off the menu (possibly replaced by the Tandoori Chicken?), I gave the Vegetarian with Japanese Eggplant a try, and have alternated between that and the Wild Mushroom since.  Although the Vegetarian with Japanese Eggplant probably isn't for everyone, I highly recommend it for anyone who's looking for a health(ier) pizza, and who doesn't mind going without meat.  Besides eggplant, it's topped with sundried tomatoes, baby broccoli, corn, onions, and mushrooms.  It's available on honeywheat dough, but I tried that once and didn't enjoy it. The Wild Mushroom is excellent for mushroom lovers (obviously), as it contains four different mushrooms.  It goes well with chicken added, which I go for about half the time. I've never had any of their pastas here, as I figure if I wanted pasta, I could step next door to Buca di Beppo or Cheesecake Factory.  I'm here for one thing only--pizza. Another plus is their offerings of differently flavored lemonade (peach lemonade is just a tad too sweet), iced tea (peach iced tea is great), and Italian soda (peach soda was good until I cut sodas out of my diet). On this particular occasion, the first thing I noticed when we walked in was the unenthusiastic hostess we were greeted by.  She didn't seem to be having a good day, but was making no effort to hide it.  After we sat, we waited about five minutes before our server swung be to say that she'd be right with us.  We waited about another five minutes before she came back.  As I have previously stated, I'm not too picky about restaurant service and don't get upset by three-star service--I simply feel I should mention it when I write a posting. When our pizzas came out, mine was only lukewarm, not piping-hot as I have often had mine here.  I understand that different pizzas take different amounts of time to cook, but perhaps keeping all pizzas hot until they are served would be something to consider.  The more important thing was that my Vegetarian with Japanese Eggplant was good, as it always is.  The server, meanwhile, did come by once, about ten minutes after bringing us our pizzas.  We didn't see her again until she dropped the check off.  All in all, certainly not a fine dining experience, but a relaxed, family atmosphere that offers a wide variety of pizzas--hopefully something for everyone.
This place pwnz all other pizza places. I love it a ton! The service pwnz The food pwnz And the decor PWNZ ALL.

Food - 3.5 Service - 3 Ambience - 3 The food is pretty reliable here and I've tried many a specials and have been pleased. Can't go wrong with the Original BBQ Chicken pizza; it's an old stand-by. I also enjoy the following pizzas: - Wild Mushroom - Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage - Sweet & Spicy Italian Sausage - Thai Chicken From the pasta section, I enjoy: - Jambalaya - Grilled Sausage & Penne - Kung Pao Spaghetti Last night, I tried the Blue Crab Cakes special - "Made from blue crab, pan-sauted and served with our homemade remoulade sauce. Accompanied with fresh grilled asparagus and spaghettini in a creamy lemon-caper sauce." The crab cakes were quite cooked, nicely pan seared with chunks of crabs without too much filler. The spaghettini and asparagus were nice accompaniments, but in the end, I think I would just order the blue crab cake appetizers for $7 less. I didn't think the pasta & asparagus was worth the extra $7. The last few times we've been there, I've had to ask for the bread and it usually arrived minutes before our entree, which sort of defeats the purpose of a pre-meal bread, in my eyes. Overall, this is a solid location for dinner before a movie or just a random night. We often have luck getting a table in under 20 minutes at this location, even on the weekends, especially when Cheesecake Factory wait time is 2 hours plus.

Been here a couple of times with my cousin to be honest I really dont like this place. They do have good customer service but when ever I order pizza it doesnt taste good. The second time I went there with my girl cousin I asked our waiter which pizza he recommends and he told me the goat cheese with roasted peppers. I get it and think that itll be good cause i love goat cheese on pizza. Got it withing 10-14 mins took a bite and was ok. Kept eating the same slice and it was gross i think it was the japanes eggplant. only ate 2 slices and asked for a box same with my cousins pizza. So our waiter took our plates and came back with the box. Paid our bill and left.  This is the stupidest shit ever because my cousin open both boxes to c which one was hers and when she found her box  the pizza crust that she didnt eat was put in the box. You may think the guy was being nice n courteous but its common sense if the crust was put aside theres a reason for that...Sorry but our server was dumb in the brains for doing that

My family visits this CPK very often. My favorite pizzas are the Tri-color salade pizza and the Tostada. We have never had any food poisoning or any such issues as mentioned by another reviewer. The pastas are also pretty good(the pesto cream penne) For dessert, my family likes the chocolate banana royale cake.

Minus two stars because the service can be a lil suspect.  I can't believe I'm saying this.. but for some reason, I've been craving and eating salad this whole month.. Like?? What duh?? Me... Craving healthy food?!?!? This doesn't sound right.  Anyway, if you haven't tried it already, their field greens w/ pears, candied walnuts, grilled salmon, and gorgonzola cheese is UNPARALLELED!!!! If you've been on a salad splurge such as myself, this is a must try.  My other favorite dishes: Adobe Chicken Chowder Soup Thai Pizza

I tried a few of the pizzas here and a pasta dish: Jambalaya pasta - salty but not very flavorful. Could have used more sassafras, acid, and garlic. Carne Asada pizza - meh. The carne asada was dry, and I think I'd rather have it in a tortilla anyway. Sicillian - good. I quite enjoyed this.

Atmospere is your standard CPK.  The waitress knew most of the soups were not vegetarian. However, the service stunk.  The place was nearly empty, so it really souldn't have been a problem, but it was quite slow.   The food was tasty, as usual.  I had ordered the split pea soup.  THEY DIDN'T HAVE ANY CRACKERS to go with my soup! They also had no bacon for the pizza my friend ordered.  She asked if she could get the pizza at a reduced price, since the bacon was sort of a main ingredient, and the waitress, hesitating, said no.  If she really didn't know, she should have gone to check with someone more knowledgeable. So, my friend asked for more fresh mazarella in place of the bacon.  She coudln't find any fresh mozarella at all on her pizza. I was thoroughly unimpressed. EDIT I've been here a couple more times since my last review, so thought it was time to update. On one occasion, the service was okay.  But I was essentially double-charged for my drink.  If I order a rum and coke, just because it's not on the menu, does not mean I should be charged $6 for a shot of rum and then $3 for the coke.  All the mixed drinks on the menu with more alcohol in them are cheaper than that! This last time, service was again awful.  I was looking forward to the bread, but none was ever brought.  We sat waiting for a long time after our meal to get a drink refill.  After about 15 minutes of the waitress standing at the bar, she finally decides to come tell us that she is off duty. Sad, really.  The pizzas are good, but why is service such a problem?

Just had the wild mushroom pizza with chicken... it was awesome, it was better than awesome, it was perfect. The walnut pesto is nice and light and the texture of the mushrooms was outstanding. The service here is always prompt and polite, and always happy to see you... A+ business!

Okay, I'm an unabashed lover of Hawaiian pizza... yeah, pineapple on pizza rocks!!!  If you can't accept that, then you don't understand me.  =) This place is a solid pizza joint when you are hungry for a slice.  Last night I sat outside with my kids, and we had great service.  Here's my quick review... Pros... - The Hawaiian pizza is great (try their thin neopolitan-style crust). - The restaurant is clean. - There was no waiting to get in at 7:00 on a Thursday night (not sure how it is on the weekends). Cons... - The Margherita (I spelled that wrong) pizza was overcooked.  I guess we could have sent it back, but we just had to nibble around the extra crispy parts.  =) The pizza, in my opinion, cannot hold a candle to Pizza My Heart, but it is a good alternative.  I'll be back!

This is the second time I've gone to this restaurant. Last time, I had a sandwich that was pretty decent. This time I decided I should have one of the pizzas. Since the word pizza is in the name of the restaurant, you'd think those would be particularly good. Wrong. I ordered the Hawaiian (my favorite and a simple one to make so it should be good). What I got was extremely disappointing. Barely enough ingredients to cover the bland sauce underneath. The ham was sliced so thin there were holes in it. There were probably a total of 8 small pieces of pineapple (1 per slice). I think there might have been some cheese, but didn't have my microscope with me to verify. The sauce had absolutely no flavor. To top it off, it arrived cold. It seemed as though it had been sitting on a table in the back area, placed on a cold plate and served. I started eating it because I was with friends and didn't look at it closely when it arrived. After a few bites, I just stopped eating and talked to them instead. I brought the leftovers home, but tossed it in the garbage. Overpriced and under delivered.

every time I come to this place it's just pretty mediocre, nothing special. I do love there Cobb salad and the BLT pizza those are delicious. However cpk is still kinda your run of the mill mall restaurant. The good thing about this place though is that it's usually the least crowded of all the restaurants at Oakridge.

I've been going here for a few years. I also tried their other location in the Livermore mall. One of the best pizzas in the world is right here: the Sicilian!!! OMG. It's so freakin good. Super thin crust. It's crunchy, with mouth-watering peperoni and canadian bacon; topped with aromatic basil. It's perfect the way it is. All their other pizzas are okay. I've tried 80% of the menu. Half of their salads are amazing (forgot their names; they aren't catchy), with great portions to boot. Their cocktails could be better; too many drinks with too much sugar (maybe thats what the crowd likes). The service has always been a solid 4-star. Because half their salads are so tasty, they get a 4.5 (I tend to eat healthy). Normally, if only one pizza is great, and the rest are bleh - they would get a 2.5. But this Sicilian is a HARD 5. So, overall, it's going to be a 4 for the joint. They also have pastas and such for people who don't care for pizza. I actually heard that one of them is extraordinary. Kudos for having variety. I don't know how you can't like this place. Order their Sicilian. Order their Chicken Waldorf Salad. Order a strawberry mojito. 5 stars for genius food and selection. Everything else is just a plus.

I really like this place. The good is very good and not expensive. The service is great. Our waitress last time was so cheerful and nice, The manager walks around making sure everyone is OK. I always enjoy our meals here.

We went to the restaurant before for a few times. Just dined there again for my son's bday. Still enjoyed going to this place. Ordered pizza for adults and kids. We all enjoyed it. The pizzas tasted really nice. The service was great, too. I like the wild mushroom with chicken pizza. Kids liked Hawaiian. Would recommend.

Serious Salads, Tall Beers and Outdoor Dining with Entertainment BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad with black beans, corn, jicama, cilantro, basil, tortilla strips, cheese, chicken breast, tomatoes (I get it without the onions) is a very hearty salad to go with a burrito type craving on a giant bed of salad.  Waldorf Salad with chicken, grapes, apples, candied walnuts, Gorgonzola cheese (I get it without the celery) satisfys your sweet tooth while giving you lots of fruit and lettuce to feel good about.  Since I usually go with the salad I treat myself to a super tall glass (or two) of draft beer  which are always icy cold.  The outdoor patio has large umbrellas for shade, heat lamps and some seriously interesting people watching.  Out of all the Oakridge Mall restaurants, this place has the shortest wait time on a busy Friday or Saturday night.

Another restaurant my girlfriend loves!  She loves ordering their Thai-Crunched Salad.  I've had it myself and it's not bad at all.  Their salad selection is pretty solid with large servings (you have an option of half or full size).   I've had a number of their Pizza's and I was never that impressed.  They are usually very thin but filling.  They also serve pasta with average size servings. I've had mixed reviews of these as well.  Overall, service is good, you're usually seated right away and the food arrives in a timely manner.

I hate the parking here. It's not CPK's fault so I don't blame them but when you pull into the lot there are people directing you where to go in full on orange vests and flashlights. Crazy! I didn't know Oakridge got so busy. Parking takes a while to find so if you are planning on heading out leave early bc seriously parking sucks :[.  I came by Saturday evening with a party of 6. The wait was about 45 minutes and I could see why, they were PACKED. Before that night I had never had CPK but I did hear a lot of raves about it from my coworkers who have had a lot of team building lunches there. The hosts seemed really stressed out. They weren't smiling and they seemed really focused trying to get the wait times right and people out. Again, this place was PACKED. There's seating outside in the patio area, tables and booths, and chairs available at the bar/counter area (I don't know what to call it... but you can see the ovens and everything). Everything was filled!! I really feel for the hosts, looks like they have a lot to handle on the weekends.  Once seated our waitress took our drink orders and let us browse the menu. Geez there's soooo much pizza! I didn't know what to pick so I ended up not even getting a pizza :[. I picked the Miso Seafood Salad which was good but I've had better. Pretty filling for a salad though and they do have a lot of salad options for you vegetarians out there. My BF had the Chicken Marsala and it was soooooooooooooooo good. REALLY good!! I should've ordered that but I didn't think I could finish it all. YUMMMM! My friends got the Garlic Chicken pizza I think it was? That was good too. I can see why people go crazy for the pizza. My strawberry itallian soda was ok and my BF's mango lemonade was great, better than the mango lemonade at Chevy's. WAY BETTER. Looks like I should have ordered what he ordered. Haha.  The waitress was polite and friendly. Even the manager (I think it was the manager, she was dressed differently) came to our table to ask how things were. You can tell there's a lot of effort here but they're just so darn busy that it almost makes your experience uncomfy without them doing anything wrong. I guess it's good for them that business is booming. Not a date spot for sure but it's a great environment for groups.
Love their food and good service. Most of the time, the wait is not too long. During weekends, the parking is a pain.

My wife and I agree this is currently our favorite family restaurant. Our three kids (one 4-year-old and 21-month twins) actually eat in silence! We cut up their pizza into small slices and they take care of themselves, for the most part. :) The restaurant is definitely kid-friendly, according to our expectations anyway. There are two negatives about this CPK: 1. Tables near the bathrooms smell like the bathrooms, so request a different table if you are sensitive to smells. Somehow the design of the interior space creates a draft from the bathrooms out to the tables. 2. You have to be proactive with your server. The bread rarely comes without asking for it.  Be very clear and extra clear about your order.. especially any differences from the standard menu item. Don't be timid about asking for things.. then your experience will be smooth.  You will have a great experience if you stay on top of your server. For some people this may be a huge negative, but for us it's worth it because of the great family dining experience we gain from it.

I always come here for lunch with friends, since its a cheery place and the food is great. I usually order the margherita pizaa, which is always good. Sometimes the service isn't amazing, but you don't pay a whole lot, so its expected. Good for take out or dine in, which ever way you want it, you're going to enjoy your food!

Typical chain restaurant food, and I would have rated the food as 3 stars, but the service as 1 star.  The service two days ago (8/21/11) was terrible.  Our party of 6 waited 23 minutes for a server to approach us for our drink order!  We got 5 drinks about 15 minutes later, but I had to order my iced tea twice, as well as ask for our bread twice before it was delivered!  We waited another 10 minutes for our order to be taken, and then about 25 minutes more for the food to arrive.  The party of two next to us arrived perhaps 20 minutes after we arrived, and we done with their meal before we had even received our food.  I attributed this to the fact we had ordered 5 salads (and one pizza), and they had to wait for the lettuce to grow.  But it is disturbing to see CPK staff standing around shooting the breeze with each other while customers wait.  I somehow feel that a significant portion of the price is being wasted on unnecessary and/or ineffective staff. I won't be back to this location for awhile...

I'm half and half when it comes to any CPK.  The food is either really good or just ok, the service is either meh ok or non existent.  I've never had a great experience nor have I had a bad one, but I'm just not a huge huge fan... the pizza is ok.  Hmmm....

Great Hosts/Hostess. We were assigned a Table within 8 minutes of arrival on a busy Friday evening, after a long 8 hour drive from the LA area. Great Pizza. we ordered the Original BBQ Chicken, The all, Chipotle and the Chicken Pineapple BBQ Pizzas. The waitress was great too. She graciously took our orders, brought us drinks and bread appetizers to get started. My wife and daughters loved this place. Pizzas tasted great! My wife ordered a side Caesar salad. Tasted good. The only reason I would not give this CPK a 5 star rating is for the simple fact that their side small white plates for our bread appetizers were dirty. You could see the black spots that appeared like grease, but nothing to worry about. Again our waitress quickly got those plates off the table, replaced with new plates and we were off to a great dinner. I highly recommend that waitress checks all plates and utensils prior to placing anything on the Table, just to make sure everything is clean. I would go back again to this place in any case!

The service is really great. My boyfriend and I ate there and there was a piece of plastic bag in his salad...very unappetizing. Though, the manager comped his meal to make up for it. Also, they made a brand new salad to take with us. I had one of the sandwiches and I enjoyed it very much.

When my friend said we could meet here because she loved the Thai salad, I should've taken note then. Thai salad? I thought you said it was a pizza place? I guess it is. Maybe it's just me, but Thai flavors don't sound good to me on a pizza. Their other interesting forms of fusion pastas and cuisine don't sound good either. Not only did they not sound good, but I was very unimpressed with what I got. It's actually difficult to even remember what I got.  I have eaten here twice now. I know the first time I got something with fresh basil that needed a magnifying glass in order to identify any fresh basil in it. I think I ordered the same thing the next time I went as their menu just doesn't appeal to me.  Average food at an average place with absolutely terrible parking! If this was a really good restaurant, I would pay to valet park here and go all of the time. But, no, not going to pay to valet park at a mall of all places for this chain food. There are much better offerings near here and plenty of other places to try. If I want a real pizza, this would not even be one of the options. I should've had the Thai salad - that actually did look good.
All I can say is SANTA FE CHICKEN PIZZA!!! Subtracting a star from each: -price -parking

Every time I go to CPK, I never really know what to order right away. From pizzas to sandwiches to salads to soups, I usually try to have a little bit of everything. Im always pleased too by the end of the meal. Whether I'm sharing or eating my own, CPK always has me satisfied. I give this place 3 stars though because there's not one dish that stands out to me, or keeps me wanting more. I'm just always satisfied and full. The food does taste good though and the servers I've had were really nice. Good place to eat at if you haven't already.

Came here for my 21st because I  like it here. It's bright, clean, and my house is probably going to have rooms the same color as it's walls but that is neither here nor there. I dislike having a big deal of my birthday made at places and my mother is one of those, "It's her birthday" people because she wants people to sing to her kids even though her kids don't really want to make a fuss. My sister got here early and was seated before the rest of the family made it and she mentioned to our server that it was my birthday so if they wanted to do anything for it hey could, but I didn't want a big deal made of it. She listened and every time she addressed me she called be "Birthday Girl" and brought a sundae out at the end of the meal w/o song.  I like CPK, they make great pizza. I'm a BBQ Chicken girl all the way. And I did of course get a drink, an Appleberry Sangria, it tasted like red wine and appples, interesting but good combo. My dad ordered a Mai Tai so I could try something else and it tasted like rum and fruit juice. Can you tell I'm not a great fan of alcohol  in general? But this place is nice, so go.

California Pizza Kitchen puts delicious twists on your average Pizza Hut pizza. There are lots of delicious pizzas, such as the Mango Tandoori Chicken pizza, Thai Chicken and the Buffalo chicken pizza. Yum. There are delicious dishes such as the Kung Pao Spaghetti (a must for first-timers) and Thai Linguini.  The service there is great and I'm pretty much a happy camper everytime I stop by.

4 1/2 stars. Visit this place often for lunch before an afternoon movie.  Service and ambiance are excellent.  Food is outstanding and well prepared. Soups and thin crust pizzas are particularly good.

This is another place that may not be a "wow-er", but find something you like and you're good to go. Don't bother showing up for dinner at 6pm. You will wait (whether at Oakridge or Valley Fair). Cool that they have curbside service for pick-up. I do that on weeknights. My mainstays: Love the split pea soup and love the thai chicken salad. My 6-year-old loves the cheese pizza. Frankly, I think their pizzas are weird! Oh, and if I'm dining there, I also think their Lava Colada is awesome.
I wont be back, Im not a picky eater but I couldnt finish my plate. I had a pasta dish, It had a chemical taste to it. the server didnt seem to care

God I just love this place so much.I've always had a craving for there...everything!Theres great service, always checking on me and really considerate when I change my mind. It's so hard to only have one thing here! The food is always great, and that keeps me going. It's fresh, the only food I haven't tried there is the fish because I hate fish. But everything else I have tried and have never been displeased. In the long shot, I've never had a bad experience.:)

We had the greatest experience here last week.  My husband and I had dinner, desert and drinks and were so happy when we left.  The service was FANTASTIC.  We started with some martini's  then my husband got the greek pizza with wheat crust YUMMMY and I got the mixed green salad honey glazed walnut and apple in a mustard vinegarate dressing that was to die for.  We then had the red velvet cake which was was moist and delish.  Overall an A+.
Always had a great time at this location.  Food serving time after you place the order is reasonable and the "kung pao speghetti" is something to drool for.

My friends and I were planning on seeing a movie at oakridge, so we opted to eat at the pizza kitchen. Being a Thursday night, it was not very busy. Despite this, service was S.L.O.W.(arrived at 7:15, didn't leave until 9:30). We ordered appetizers, pizzas and drinks which we were satisfied with once they managed to make it to our table. Here is the kicker: we ask for the check which totals $70. Although the service was slow, we didn't blame that on the waitress, who was actually pretty nice the whole time. We tipped her $15 (tax was roughly $6). She took the check, then returned a few minutes later saying "Ohhh, it looks like you guys only gave me $85- you underpaid, the bill is $92"  We apologized to her, and said we weren't sure how we could have misread the bill. As my friends are pulling out their wallets, I notice that the bill has gone up because the waitress forgot to add on two of the five drinks we had ordered. So she could have said "I'm sorry guys, I calculated your bill incorrectly", but she tried to tell us that WE underpaid HER. Granted, I had had a couple of drinks and was probably a little more pissed about it than I should have been, but we tipped her well based on our first bill, and she couldn't even be honest, and just slipped the higher bill in there. We asked for the manager who was very nice and understood that she made a mistake. Minus one star for slow service, minus two stars for the waitress who suddenly was throwing dirty looks our way after her error was brought to light, and plus two stars for the nice manager. Will not be returning.

Love the food (especially the chicken kung pao spaghetti). Price is fair. And the food usually comes out fairly quickly. BUT at this location the service has been HORRIBLE nearly every time I've gone. We've basically just started doing take-out instead, however, it has taken longer than they have said it would every time we've ordered. Like any lower end chain restaurant - be prepared for servers who don't give a crap.
Good pizza joint...reasonably priced with good ambience.  Kid friendly and nice service.  Also, most of the time you don't have to wait to be seated.

Price:  I think the prices are fair.  I can see how it may add up if you get appetizers (that cost just as much as the pizza) and drinks.  I think you get what you pay for. Service:  I think this was the reason I went from a possible 3 star to a 4 star.  My friends and I arrived a little later after a beach trip and noticed that many people weren't there.  We found parking right in front of the restaurant at Oakridge, which is a miracle.  Made sense since they were closing.  Even still, they gave us exceptional service and catered to all our needs.  It kind of killed it seeing every clean everything around you, making you feel a little guilty, but they didn't pressure us to hurry up and finish.  The waitress was very friendly and made sure we enjoyed the experience. Taste:  I'm sure what you choose to order and eat will make a huge difference in the taste you experience.  I can't say I've been here enough to know what's good and what's not.  I had the chipotle pizza and I was a little disappointed.  Part of the reason being that they ran out of the special salsa you would put on there.  It was basically a pizza with chicken and the chipotle sauce (that wasn't even that spicy - since I asked fora  spicy pizza).  I had to add hot sauce, corn, and black beans myself to make it better (that's the disappointing part - I had to enhance their recipe).  The waitress did give me some assurance by offering to take it off the bill if it wasn't up to my standards.  After finishing the whole pizza, I felt it would've been wrong to say I didn't enjoy it.  I do have to add that I've tried the CPK frozen pizzas that you can buy at the grocery stores and the taste is mighty similar (food for thought). Atmosphere:  It was a nice relaxing atmosphere.  Soft music in the background, comfortable seats, and tv's near the bar.  They also had some cool art work made out of the CPK pizza boxes.  They are all displayed on the walls.  Very creative and original. What You'll Remember:  For being a pizza place, they sure have a lot on their menu.  It may take a while to figure out what you want to order. Comment:  This wasn't the most amazing pizza I've had.  I think I've been more satisfied with delivery and some beer.  They do have some interesting choices of flavor and toppings.  Like I mentioned, as I was eating the pizza at the restaurant, I couldn't help but think it tasted awfully the same as the CPK frozen pizza I had from safeway.  Maybe I had too much sun that day...  Let me know if you come across that thought as well :) Cheers, T-Chung

my boyfriend and i was shopping at oakridge mall, so by the time that we were all done shopping we were already hungry, i wanted cpk but as we got in there was no host, all the workers in the back doing whatever that they're supposed to be doing., they looked at us but we didnt get any acknowledge whatsoever!! so we left cpk hungry and angry. Poor service!!
The meal was great. I had never eaten in the place always had take out. Service was awesome, meal came out quickly and at the right temperature. The place is not cheap...but worth it in my opinion.

I came here the other day with my friend for lunch.  I had a very traumatizing incident at the Valley Fair CPK a few days before but was still craving that damn Waldorf Salad!  We sat down, ordered drinks (I had a sugar free peach iced tea) and was promptly served bread and butter.  I already knew what I wanted but we had to decided on appetizers.  I mentioned how I liked the Tortilla Spring Rolls so we ordered the Mediterranean and Baja Chicken ones and also the Garlic Cheese Focaccia.  The service was really great and I did not find a single hair in my salad!  Our food was fresh and really tasty!  This is going to be my go-to CPK from now on..

We had a party of 3 for lunch on a Saturday. We found the whole staff welcoming. Our server, Christina, was great. She was attentive, without hovering, knowledgeable about the menu, and prompt with her service. We thought the menu offerings were fun, interesting, and extensive. The food was tasty. We had 2 different kinds of pizza, standard cheese, and a mushroom blend. Both were good, not too heavy, and satisfying. These are not to be mistaken for New York quality pizzas, but they were fine for California, and when you need something different than Mexican. We received our second salad the same time as the pizza, and Christina did not blink an eye when we asked to cancel the salad. She assured us it would not appear on our bill. Later the manager came to check on us and to apologize for the late arriving salad. He also assured us that the salad would not be on our bill. Overall, a pleasant dining experience, and we will be back. My wife, a former restaurant owner, gives it a 10.
Just like any other CPK I've been too.  Love their food, good service, nothing phenominal.  If you're in the mood for CPK, then stop by.

I love Pizza. I always get the Hawaiian Pizza, always. But yet we went to CPK, and as I began to look at the menu, one Pizza caught my eye. The Italian Tomato & Basil Pizza. Imported Italian tomatoes, Mozzarella cheese and tomato sauce, topped with fresh basil and Parmesan cheese. Oh and I added grilled shredded chicken to it. So awesome!!!! It was the best. I was in heaven!!! I have never tasted anything like that. The tomatoes were so chunky, cheese was melted just right! Ah I went back again the next week for it! I just can't get enough!!

I ended up here after realizing BJ's was jam packed for the sharks game! I know I was dumb for thinking I'd be able to get a seat at the bar.Being that it was playoffs and already in the 2nd period of game 7 when the sharks stomped the red wings, I knew there was no way in hell I was leaving the mall to search for a new place to watch the game. We decided to check CPK and we found out they had a sorry excuse for a tv. I figured it'd be ok. Well I was wrong. As soon as 5 minutes passed the TV started cutting out. Talk about wrong time to cut out. My girlfriend said we should go, but there was no way I could miss any more. I was surprised that that was there only TV especially since I'm sitting at a bar. The bartender, however, was pretty cool and came to check on us often. The food wasn't bad either. It wasn't anything special, but it wasn't bad. I did think they were way overpriced. It was like getting cheap pizza for restaurant price. I would only go back on rare occasion, but NEVER to watch anything on their tvs.

they are one fast restuarant. right we ordered, our food came by 10 minutes later. its some fast service for a pizza place. but i have to admit. i love their CHINESE CHICKEN SALAD! i can eat that for days. and to top it off... with some original bbq chicken pizza. mmmm

I have been also to the one at Valley Fair and one in the LA area.  The food seems consistent through out.  I love salads.  I had the most amazing cob salad last week.  I was waiting for my car at Sears to get the battery replaced and realized I hadn't had anything to eat.  So I may have been starving but the salad was wonderful.  I ordered a half which was a perfect amount.  I didn't get any pizza this time.  I love the pizza but usually just get the salad and sometimes share a slice.

We got the most patient, relaxed server ever.  He was really great and offered tips of pizzas he enjoyed when I couldn't figure out what to get.  When i finally did order, the food came quickly and was freakin delicous.  The service was great, he didn't hover too much or take forever to help us, and the food was the usual CPK awesomeness.
Great food if you like thin crust pizza. great location at oakridge mall, but parking can be difficult on the weekends.

I hesitate to give five stars to a pizza restaurant, but after dozens of visits to this particular location, I feel they earned it. By being a very nice place to take our two young boys, having the best mac and cheese ever (our five year old requires this) and the food is always good to excellent. Many restaurants are difficult with children, some almost hostile. Most are neutral but for some intangible reason, this one always works out very well for us. We don't even care to fuss with the mall due to the congestion, but we will go there specifically to eat at this restaurant.

I've been to this CPK a couple times and found it to be very good. I recently went last week with my family and decided to try something new. Instead of their delicious pizza, I tried the Chicken Tequila Pasta. It turned out to be amazing and was recommended to me by our waiter. It has a powerful lime taste but it is not overpowering. The service was good and we only had to wait a few minutes to get a table. The food is fairly priced and the portions are fair as well.
They offer pretty yummy GLUTEN FREE PIZZA!!! I used a %20 coupon and we each got drinks = good deal!

The food here is OKAY to me, but my fiance seems to love it.  We went there this past Saturday.  We were seated right away, and at first, the waiter's personality seemed a little dry.  My fiance ordered the Jamaican Jerk pizza, and I ordered the hawaiian, but wanted to substitute the ham for pepperoni.  Well, the manager came over with my fiance's pizza, but was sincerely apologetic that the kitchen didn't make my pizza right. I told him it was no big deal... so he rushed it right out.  Not only did he take it off my bill, but the waiter offered us free dessert!  It was pretty cool.  If you aren't huge on the food, the service is at least pretty good.

I love California Pizza Kitchen just not this location.  I have been here exactly three times and can honestly say that 2 out of the 3 have been horrible.  Why might I come back for seconds and thirds?  Well I always want to give places a couple of tries before I can truly say that I dislike them.  I figured I'm not going to be given the same waitress and crappy service each and every time I come here.  Boy was I wrong.   The last time I was here I was nicely greeted by the hostess and immediately seated.  I figured that since there was only a couple of people in the restaurant that we would promptly be greeted by our waitress.  WRONG!!! We were sitting at our table for awhile till somebody could tear away from their busy conversations around the bar area to greet us.   My boyfriend and I already knew what we wanted to eat given the extra time so decided to order our food along with the drinks.  Well our waitress brings our drinks awhile later and let's us know that our food should be coming.
