Well that was a big fat lie.  I don't know if they were growing the food back in the kitchen but that's what it seemed like because our food took forever to come out.  On top of that our waitress never gives us bread or refills for our drinks.  Funny thing is that I'm a slow eater and drinker.   After much conversation with my boyfriend about leaving and just paying for the drinks he convinces me to wait it out.    Our food finally comes out from someone else besides our waitress and I don't see her till we are too full to finish our meals.  Never did she come to our table to ask if we needed anything.  We had to flag down another waiter to get our drinks refilled.  Huge mistake in terms of service especially for someone who's worked the same job as she had once upon a time.   So our waitress finally shows up to give us the bill and I immediately hand over the c/c for fear she will disappear once again.  She comes hands us the receipts and disappears again.  Unfortunately, for us we forget to ask her for some boxes for the unfinished food.  Once again we were at the mercy of someone else besides our waitress to get us some boxes.  The whole time she was sitting down deep in conversation with another waitress in the back of the restaurant with clear view of us if she had a mindful eye.  Extremely irritated I did not want to leave her a tip.  However, my boyfriend was the one who paid the bill and did not want to stiff her.  It's not in his nature to ever complain or stiff someone even for bad service.  We talked about it and both decided to leave her a tip but a small tip.   I can honestly say I will never come back to this location.  I'd rather go to the Stevens Creek location where I've eaten a dozen times and have never had one bad service.

This 5 is for the bbq chicken pizza. It's just incomparably fantastic. Yummy grilled chicken and sweet bbq sauce, tons of gooey gouda and mozzarella, fresh red onions and cilantro...so delicious. This is my ultimate fave pizza. Love love love.

I've eaten here a few times (and at other locations) and typically we have good service and good food... but, I guess there's always that ONE time you go.. .and...  We went here for a quick bite to eat, it was a Monday evening.  We arrived around 7:30pm (ish).  When we arrived we were promptly greeted and seated.  And that's about the only thing that went right at this place.   Let me break down what happened in point form here: 1.  No server came by to introduce themselves, offer water, offer bread, etc... the usual stuff.  We had to wait 20 minutes before I got so fed up with waiting that I grabbed the first server that made eye contact with me (not literally grabbed.. cuz that would be weird and wrong).  She wasn't our server, but she was kind enough to take our order (I'll refer to her as our temp server going forward).  As soon as she left, our server decided to pop in and introduce himself.  (great timing).  He made some excuse about how they had sent someone home early and he didn't know we were seated in his area, since it was expanded to cover the guy that left.  I think that's a load of shit.  Then he disappeared. 2.  Our server, even our temp server who took our order, did not offer us any bread while we waited (which is fine, it's the thought that counts here guys). 3. We wait another 15 - 20 minutes for our appetizers.  Meanwhile, people who are seated after us are getting their appetizers... bread... AND entres...   The temp server came by to let us know that our food will be out in a minute (which was again nice)  Our actual server?  huh?  Where the hell is he? 4. Appetizers come out, we ordered their advertised deep fried artichoke hearts.  Terrible, not worth the $4.  There were literally 5 pieces that were smaller than my ....baby toe.  And they were over cooked. 5. Pizza's came in really quickly after our appetizers, so we were scrambling for table space. 6. Pizza's... ready for this?... NOT cut.  at all.  So I had to cut it with a knife (again, it's the little things right?) 7. Server comes by to check on us (way later in the meal, and after the floor manager did his rounds to check on us).  He was standing there with a full carafe of water... yet he did not fill our glasses or even ask to see if we wanted to have our water filled.... then he left.  We later flagged him down for some water refills... 8. We waited another 20 minutes for the manager to notice that we were finished eating.  Our server?  He was eating at another booth with another worker, I guess when they go on break they go on break, and the customer has to wait for them?  C'mon...  We obviously didn't tip the guy (argue all you want about mandatory tipping... because that's another argument.. and you won't win).  As we left I went to the manager to discuss our issues, so that at least he could address it with his employees.  He offered his apologies and offered us 20% off our bill, which was a nice gesture, but I refused.  I'm not one of those guys that complains about the food/service to get a free meal.  Hell if I was, I'd have brought a severed finger and complained about a finger being cooked into my chili... (eh?  anyone?  no one gets the wendy's reference?)... bah.. well, that's how I felt about this place.

My husband and I love CPK!  We love that we can come into the restaurant and if it's busy we can find a place at the bar and be offered to knotch service, just as if we were at a table.  We love their menu and their pizza, salads and soups (our favorite is Split Pea and Barley) are healthy, fresh and delicious.  Our date nights are few and far between so getting out for a moment to breathe is very nice and CPK has great service and food for sure.

I went here for lunch on a weekday, it was big, clean, very friendly service and attentive.  I had a mushroom ravioli, it was pretty good, with a tasty sauce.  Everyone else had pizza, I am not a pizza fan really, but everyone seemed to really like it and kept the leftovers for home.  It seems to be a bit pricey for what it is, but its the name and not the place.  It can get really busy because its at the mall and has all the tech companies and what not around it.  Its good but nothing to write home about or really seek out again.

CPK is the bomb. I'd avoid weekends. But that's when I avoid malls entirely anyways. I get curbside take out all the time, because I'm ultra lazy. I'm in love with the cobb salad, which really isn't much of the text book definition of a cobb salad. But if you want a really great salad thats always fresh, CPK has the hook up. and they have awesome gourmet pizzas, um yum!

Came here with a friend for lunch and had the Quesadilla pizza. Pretty good actually. Standard service. Nothing to write home about. Nothing to complain about either. I'll be back when I get the urge or someone brings up the idea to go.
I love their thin crust pizzas, and their chopped salad. The servers aren't always the best, but the food comes out quick and pretty good.

This is my favorite indulgence that fits in my budget. They have food that pleases eveyone from my 7 year old cousin to my grandmother. Even my mom, a vegan can find enjoyable dishes here. I give it a five for the food and for the service. I have never had a bad experiance, in fact I have always felt like thy have the friendliest staff around. It's great for a casual evening out.

This place is awful!  The food was cold, bland, small servings, and the prices were outrageous!  Over $60 for bad pizza and salad (NO BEVERAGES)?!  The only way to stomach this is with plenty of beer...... We won't be back.
The food here is decent, some really like their pizza like the Thai chicken, but to me, it is nothing out of the extraordinary.

I've eaten at this particular location on more than one occasion and never had a problem.  I guess I was due.  Came here on a Friday evening and was suprised to see that there wasn't a wait nor line out the door.  Hmm...was that a hint?  Anyway, after perusing the menu I decided I'd just go with the usual - sundried tomato brocolli fusilli pasta, this time however with chicken.  Our waitress seemed like she was in a bad mood right from the get go, not that she was rude but she seemed like she had other things on her mind.  When asked for extra napkins, we were given a stack of cocktail napkins, not dinner napkins. !?!?  Ooook. After given our food, she didnt once come back to check on us.  At another table, she dropped off a spice/oil rack but literally walked by without stopping and plopped it on the table rather abruptly.  To top it off though, after scarfing up my delicious meal - I fell ill.  My stomach was killing me for the rest of the weekend.  Not even pepto could ease the pain.  I blame the chicken!!   One star for getting seated right away and another for the meal itself.  Hmm..I'm even tempted to subtract that given I got sick from that meal.

Three of us (2 adults and 1 thirteen year old boy) decided to get CPK to go so we could watch the Sharks game at home - they don't have the channel.  We thought it would be great to use their drive up/to go service, so we called the order in, drove to the restaurant and found NO PARKING available.  After talking to the nice valet folks, we parked curbside in the yellow spot for valet only, called the restaurant as they instructed and waited for our food.  The bill for 2 salads and 2 pizzas was over $62!  I guess we should've clued into the high cost when we realized the website didn't show any prices,  The pizzas were not only cold, but small and tasteless.  I've had better pizza from Dominoes!  The salads were mediocre.  The three of us are all fairly thin, so 2 pizzas and two full sized salads should've been more than enough - it barely filled us.  The pizzas were small - makes me wonder what the kid's size is - maybe made with one of those easy-bake ovens?  Overall a very disappointing experience with bad, overpriced food.  We will not be back........

I rather enjoyed my visit here. I asked for a recommendation and they suggested some pasta with tequila in it.  It was fairly good, except for the fact that I found a piece of plastic in my food. I liked how they handled the situation however. I notified the waitress, who then, told the manager, who not only comped my meal, but said I could get anything else for free as well. So i tried to shrimp cocktail, and that was pretty good as well. However, I had to lower my rating because shortly after my sister found a piece of foil in her food. We didn't say anything, because we didn't want it to look like we were all trying to get free food. But that says something about the kitchen. The food and service were great though.

I've been here probably thousands of times within my lifetime, but don't know why I've never reviewed! The service here isn't always very good, but the food is amazing. I find myself craving CPK so often, and ordering the same exact meal every time I go. It is such a treat, I look forward to it every time I go out to a movie or have to pass by the mall. I just wish it was open a little later like Cheesecake Factory!

location: South San Jose, San Jose, CA
review: Always good food, the bartender Eric is great. Just wish they had slightly bigger TV's than I could stop going to BDubs.

CPK typically doesn't disappoint. If you like great salads and fun pizzas, it is definitely a good spot. Because it's a chain, you grow to expect the same things at each restaurant. One of those things is good service. The food at this restaurant was great, everything was amazing. I love all their salads and their pizzas are so unique and trendy (even if I always want the BBQ chicken).  Our experience here was pretty poor. We had no problem until after we ordered our dinner. Our server never came back, and we were left without drinks, then without a bill, and had to go in search of someone so we could pay. It really was disappointing. We ended up contacting the bartender and were given our bill, paid, and left, all without coming in contact with our server. Just bad!
Foods amazung customer service needs work went in yesterday megqn the host needs a promotion

Not my go to spot for pizza, but since we were in the area and it was getting late I decided to dine-in.  I had an order of the baja chicken tortilla spring rolls for starters and pizza for the main course. The appetizer was the best part of the meal, the guacamole it came with was awesome.  Unfortunately the pizza was not that great, probably a bad selection on I choice but when I ordered the waitress added "good choice". It was far from it, the actual pizza isn't the problem cause it was seasoned well but the sauce ruined it, just overpoweringly sweet.

Came here during lunch rush hour on MLK day. Mall was insane. California Pizza Kitchen was packed but they sat us within 10 minutes. We sat down and were ignored for about 10 minutes. We finally flagged down a waitress to ask if they can take our drink order. We asked for water and she said she would bring it right out. All of the waitresses looked stressed out. Two managers were walking around helping pass out food to customers. One of the managers noticed us and asked if he can take our drink order and said our waitress would be right with us. We were a bit confused since we already ordered our waters. Anyways, we said we were ready to place our orders. He was very pleasant, and took down our orders. The waitress came back with our waters and said, sorry, I know our manager already took your order. Sorry about the other waitress but I guess I will be your waitress now. Your food will be right out, is there anything else I can get you? We told her no, we were fine. As a customer, I have no idea what is happening behind the scenes. Although its apparent, everyone looks stressed out, we have not officially met our waitress who is suppose to be assigned to us- and how were we suppose to know? I thought all of that was unnecessary. Just give us our drinks, and our food. The waitress was very pleasant, and nice the whole time. Service was ok- we did not need a lot of the explanation of  another waitress who was suppose to be serving us or the behind the scenes miscommunication, blah, blah, blah. I don't know about the customer service today, it was kind of all over the place, but they got it together as the restaurant slowed down.  Food was alright. I ordered the tortilla soup and the italian sandwich. I guess it is my fault for not ordering the restaurants specialty- pizza. My friend enjoyed her chicken caesar salad. The Italian sandwich was gross. The sandwich was flimsy and I wish I had ordered something else. I probably should have returned it, and ordered something different, but I ended up picking at the sandwich and only eating half (not including the bread).  Maybe my taste buds are changing as I get older, but I am just not too crazy about CPK anymore. Food is overpriced, and not worth, mediocre food.

Came in around 5:30pm on a Wednesday evening. Got seated right away & got our orders taken. I ordered their new drink which is the strawberry mango cooler, it very refreshing. Especially for this hot summer weather.  As my entree I had ordered the four cheese ravioli, I usually go for their regular chicken pastas but I thought I should give this a try.  At first glance the plating seemed a bit small, looked like 10 pieces of ravioli. It seemed more of a little snack for me but I suppose it was a good portion. The seasoning and the overall taste of it was very good. Highly recommended.  Also got the red velvet slice as dessert, opted out for the optional ice cream side. The red velvet was nice and moist & was a decent sized portion. The frosting is delectable as well

I love CPK and have always enjoyed good food and good service. But on my most recent visit, my favorite pizza and one of the healthier ones, the pear and Gorgonzola thin crust pizza was taken off the menu. This is a favorite of mine and a family favorite. Very disappointed that CPK took such a yummy and unique pizza (and vegetarian) option off the menu and replaced it with something non-vegetarian. Bring back the pear and Gorgonzola pizza!

I loved this restaurant. The hostess, I believe her name was Natalie, was so sweet and sat us at a table way quicker than we expected. She was so welcoming. Our server was so great and quick. We loved him!

My family loves stopping by when we are in town. Although their specialty is pizza , I strongly suggest their pasta options. The pizza is not as great as it is advertised. Service can be great at times but not dependable when the restaurant is busy.
I love CPK for their hearty Mashed Pea Soup, Pita/Hummus Appetizer with a whole grain option and veggie pizzas again with a whole grain option. We go here a lot and service is pretty good as well.
Such a small portion.  I got a full size Chinese chicken salad to go.  I can't believe for what I got It is $15.  Time to get bigger to go containers CPK or use 2 of them.

I love CPK. We used to go to the CPK close our home almost every weekend. They changed their menu of that CPK, they got rid of my favorite Tiramisu, that discouraged me from going to that CPK. This CPK is little far for us, so instead of going to CPK every week, we go there once in a while. I have tried all the veggie Pizza and Pastas, Salad and Soup here, I can't complain about anything, its always awesome. My all time favorite is Chipotle Chicken Pizza with No Chicken :) and Tiramisu.

We just did the kids make your own pizza and pumpkin decorating.  So much fun for the kiddies and adults relaxed with a margarita, salad and chicken wrap.  Fantastic experience!  Thanks CPK team :) :) :)

Great food! Very pleasantly surprised when my husband and I were looking for a last minute dinner on a whim and tried two other restaurants at the mall near where we were running errands and they both had a 30 min wait. Decided to try California Pizza Kitchen - no waiting, fantastic Moscow miles and hand shaken agave mojito's, the special wild mushroom rolled pasta - couldn't get enough of that taste! An asparagus and arugula small plate salad with shaved Parmesan, sun dried tomatoes and peanuts was the perfect accompaniment and the right size to share. SO glad we happened in here way under rated!

Too many times we are looking for what is wrong with a business!  I have to tell you what a fun. We had with Therese the bar tender that was not afraid to make recommendations and her manager Deanna!   They made us feel welcome and visited with us!  They had a tremendous amount of clients and to go orders and still took the time to make sure our dinner was just perfect!  Loved it and we will be back!  We had the prime rib think behind the crust!  No wait! Dinner was great and so was the sangria flight!
We got Bianco from the flatbreads. This I liked very much. But the two star is for the jambalaya which lacked salt and taste.

Well, of course I can only rate a chain restaurant like CPK a 3-star, especially since I've had some really good pizza in my life like Chicago deep dish pizza, and a few great NY pizza slices. As everyone else does when they go to CPK, we always order the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza (rate a 3/5) for $13.59. I remember it being a lot better when I was younger. Not sure if it just had something to do with this particular location that we visited about a week and a half ago for my little brother's college graduation celebration. Anyway, it's the standard order when we go to a CPK, which by the way, we haven't visited one in like... over 2.5 years. Anyway, the other pizza that I really like is a lesser known one, the Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza, which is listed on the thin-crust pizza section, but you can get it hand-tossed, which is what we did. I'd rate this pizza a 3.5/5, and it costs the same as the BBQ Chicken Pizza ($13.59). The Jamaican Jerk has a little bit of a kick to it, which we like. With all of the pizzas, we like to order a side of ranch to dip our crust, because the crust by itself doesn't taste like anything. We went with a group of 11 people, and each of us pretty much ordered an individual pizza, so we definitely ran the bill up. I personally think that the pizzas are a little pricey at almost $14 a pizza for 6 pretty small slices. But I guess that's just inflation.  In terms of service, our server wasn't the best. She didn't really know much about the pizzas and she definitely wasn't in the best of moods, and it didn't seem to put in an extra effort handling a larger group. Oh well, I guess.  We probably won't be going back to a CPK for a while, but I always enjoy those 2 pizzas, even though they are a little expensive in my books. Service could certainly use an upgrade, but all in all, CPK is always a fun, casual location to hang out with family and friends.

Yum to the scampi shrimp pizza "limited time till January 2016" get it before it's gone:) it has there lemon garlic sauce with mozzarella, Romano cheese, shrimp and arugula salad on top it was just delicious! I'm mosdef gonna get it again and I also got their strawberry mango spritzer it was so good. Too bad not refills. Good dinner

I had a wonderful experience this morning.  I came in today around 11:50am and Andy helped me out.  Andy was very friendly and professional, he made me feel very welcomed which I Love.  Also, two other managers came to make sure I've been helped. On my way out the hostess girl was very nice, smiled, also friendly and thanked me and said goodbye. Then the gentleman working there named Kellen open the door for me.  Kellen is very sweet and made my experience here a great one.  Made my day. Thank you.
